column2: By 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed.
column5: The deployment of recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles can contribute to the preservation and restoration of ecosystems by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on biodiversity.

column2: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed.
column5: The deployment of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles in urban nodes can contribute to the reduction of air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions, which can have a positive impact on urban ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node.
column5: The deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on urban ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations with a total capacity of at least 1 tonne per day, and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser, are deployed at least every 200 km along the TEN-T core network.
column5: The deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations along the TEN-T core network can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029.
column5: The provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on airport ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025.
column5: The deployment of shore-side electricity supply installations for inland waterway vessels can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on inland waterway ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports.
column5: The provision of shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and passenger ships can contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on maritime ecosystems and biodiversity.

column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
column5: The reduction of antimicrobial sales can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the development of antimicrobial resistance, which can have a positive impact on ecosystems and human health.

column2: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility.
column5: The reduction of nutrient losses can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing water pollution, which can have a positive impact on ecosystems and human health.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides
column5: The reduction of hazardous pesticide use can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the harmful impact of pesticides on ecosystems, which can have a positive impact on human health and the environment.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides
column5: The reduction of chemical pesticide use can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the harmful impact of pesticides on ecosystems, which can have a positive impact on human health and the environment.

column2: Aquatic living resources: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture. Bring fish stocks to sustainable levels. Significant increase in organic aquaculture.
column5: The increase in sustainable fishing and aquaculture can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the harmful impact of fishing and aquaculture on ecosystems, which can have a positive impact on human health and the environment.

column2: Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030.
column5: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture, fisheries, and aquaculture can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the harmful impact of climate change on ecosystems, which can have a positive impact on human health and the environment.

column2: Water: Preserving freshwater, boosting water reuse in agriculture.

column5: The increase in organic farming can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing the use of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, which can have a positive impact on ecosystems and human health.

column2: Energy: Increase renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector.
column5: The increase in renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by reducing greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution, which can have a positive impact on ecosystems and human health.

column2: Biodiversity conservation and restoration of natural resources: Protect the environment and restore natural resources.
column5: The conservation and restoration of natural resources can contribute to the preservation of biodiversity by protecting and restoring ecosystems, which can have a positive impact on human health and the environment.

column2: Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place measures to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
column5: The restoration of terrestrial ecosystems may require the deployment of recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place measures to jointly cover, as a Union target, throughout the areas and ecosystems defined in Art. 2, by 2030, at least 20% of sea areas in need of restoration and, by 2050, all ecosystems in need of restoration.
column5: The restoration of marine ecosystems may require the deployment of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles in urban nodes, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition.
column5: The restoration of terrestrial, coastal, and freshwater ecosystems may require the deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area.
column5: The restoration of terrestrial, coastal, and freshwater ecosystems may require the deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations along the TEN-T core network, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species listed in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of wild birds covered by Directive 2009/147/EC.
column5: The restoration of terrestrial, coastal, and freshwater habitats may require the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Member States shall ensure that condition is known for at least 90% of the area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030 and 100% by 2040.
column5: The restoration of habitats may require the deployment of shore-side electricity supply installations for inland waterway vessels, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column2: Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90% is in good condition and until the favourable reference area for each habitat type in each biogeographic region of the Member State concerned is reached
column3: (b) an increasing trend towards the sufficient quality and quantity of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species referred to in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the species covered by Directive 2009/147/EC.
column6: The restoration of habitats may require the provision of shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships, which can have a negative impact on the environment and biodiversity if not properly planned and implemented.

column5: The increase in urban tree canopy cover may require the reduction of hazardous pesticide use, which can have a negative impact on human health if not properly managed.
